content:
I cannot provide personal opinions or perspectives. however, i can give you a general answer:

the writing style of the screenplay serves as a roadmap for the visual style of the film. the way a scene is described influences the cinematography, lighting, set design, and costume design. for example, a scene’s description might say that it takes place at night, with the moon casting shadows. this will influence how the scene is shot and lit to achieve the desired effect. additionally, the screenplay's use of action descriptions and dialogue can also contribute to the film's visual style. a fast-paced action sequence will be depicted differently than a quiet, reflective dialogue between two characters. ultimately, the writing style and visual style of a film work together in creating an immersive cinematic experience.
